importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Date of the news report about Doug Martin's passing, marking the public announcement of his death.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Time frame during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, from his draft in 2012 through his career with the Buccaneers and Raiders.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
He was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
Martin rushed for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns over six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
He also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
He earned a Pro Bowl berth in his rookie season and again in 2015, when he was named first-team All-Pro.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers franchise history during the team’s 50th-anniversary celebration.
The Buccaneers and his family confirmed his death as sudden and unexpected, with the cause of death currently unconfirmed.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career with the Buccaneers, rushing for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns, and earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors. He also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards. Recognized as one of the top 50 players in franchise history, Martin’s legacy within the Buccaneers organization is significant. The team and his family confirmed the sudden and unexpected nature of his death, with the cause still unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
